title: The One Where Chandler Can't Remember Which Sister

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Phoebe, Ross, Joey, and Rachel are
there, Joey is demonstrating a card trick.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, pick a card, any card. (Monica picks one) All right, now memorize it. Show to everybody. Got it?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Um-mm.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, give it back to me. (takes the card back, but he looks at the card before he puts it back in the deck, he holds the deck to his forehead, and thinks a little while) 5 of hearts.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Real magic does exist.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow. Joey, (sarcastically) how do you do it?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I can’t tell you that, no.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, somebody’s at the door on the ceiling.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Noo, that’s our unbelievably loud upstairs neighbor.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He took up the carpet, and now you can hear everything.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Why don’t you go up there and ask him to ‘step lightly, please?’

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I have like five times, but the guy is so charming, that I go up there to yell and then I end up apologizing to him.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh, that is silly. (gets up) I’ll go up there, I’ll tell him to keep it down.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, be my guest.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Good luck.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, all right, all right, all right, all right, you really wanna know how I did it, I’ll show ya. When you handed me back the card, what you didn’t see was, I looked at it so fast that it was invisible to the naked eye. (picks up a card and quickly looks at it) I just did it. (does it again) I just did it, again. Here, I’ll slow it down so that you guys can see it. (looks and the card in slow motion)

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh, I got it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (muffled through the floor) Yeah, look I was with my friend downstairs and we hear everything up here that you do, and I am sick and tired... (I tired but the rest is unintelligible).

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: (muffled) Whoa, you are very beautiful.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (muffled) Oh, thank you.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey, anybody got a length of rope about six feet long with a little nouse at the end?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Honey, what’s the matter?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I just saw Janice.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, she was at Rockefeller Center skating with her husband, she looked so happy. I almost feel bad for whipping that kid’s pretzel at them.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Man, I remember the first time I saw that girl Katherine, after we broke up. She was just walking with her friend Donna, just laughing and talking. God, it killed me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, but you ended up having sex with both of them that afternoon.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sorry, I just, any excuse to tell that story y'know....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey Chandler, there’s a party tomorrow, you’ll feel better then.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, y'know what, I’m gonna be okay, you don’t have to throw a party for me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It’s Joey’s birthday.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, well then, if anybody should have a party it should be him.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sush!! I cannot believe she is still up there.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, well he totally screwed up the punch line. Y'know, it’s supposed to be arrghh-eh og-errigh.

dialogue.speaker: MR. KAPLAN
dialogue.text: (entering) How’s that coffee comin,’ dear?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (jumping up from reading her magazine) Yeah, right away Mr. Kaplan.

dialogue.speaker: MR. KAPLAN
dialogue.text: I’m not supposed to drink coffee, it makes me gassy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know!

dialogue.speaker: MR. KAPLAN
dialogue.text: I’ll bet your thinking, ‘What’s an intelligent girl who wants to be in fashion, doing making coffee?’ Eh?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Op.

dialogue.speaker: MR. KAPLAN
dialogue.text: Eh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, you got me.

dialogue.speaker: MR. KAPLAN
dialogue.text: Well, don’t think I haven’t noticed your potential. Well, I’ve got a project for you that’s a lot more related to fashion. How does that sound?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, that sounds great.

dialogue.speaker: MR. KAPLAN
dialogue.text: Come on over here, sweetheart. (they walk over to a storage closet)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh thank you so much Mr. Kaplan, thank you so much.

dialogue.speaker: MR. KAPLAN
dialogue.text: (opening the closet door revealing that it’s full of tangled up hangers.) I need these hangers separated ASAP. (she is stunned) You’re welcome.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Moondance Diner, Rachel is talking to Monica about her job.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God, I hate my job, I hate it, I hate my job, I hate it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know honey, I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I wanna quit, but then I think I should stick it out, then I think why would such a person stay in such a demeaning job, just because it’s remotely related to the field they’re interested in.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (gives her a look) Gee, I don’t know Rach. Order up!! I got a Yentel soup, a James Beans, and a Howdy hold the Dowdy!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh honey, come on, I’m sorry, I didn’t.... I don’t mind paying my dues, y'know, its just how much am I gonna learn about fashion by walking Mira, the arthritic seamstress, to the bathroom.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to him) Hi! Is my misery amusing to you?

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: I’m sorry, I wa, I wa, I was just ah.... (starts to laugh again)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: It’s not funny, this is actually my job.

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Oh believe me, I-I-I’ve been there. I had to sort mannequin heads at that Mannequins Plus.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh well then, so I’m just going to go back to talking to my friend here. And you can go back to enjoying your little hamburger.

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Ah, just one other thing.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes?!

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: I ah, I work at Bloomingdale’s and I might know of a job possibility if your, if your interested?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (looks at Monica) (to him) Do you want my pickle?

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, it’s Joey’s party.]

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: (to Monica and Phoebe) Hey guys.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey Gunther. Hi. (to Phoebe) I mean you’re going out on a date with the noisy guy upstairs?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, he’s very charming.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know, he’s too charming, but if you two start going out, then it’s just gonna make it so much harder for me to hate him.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, you’re just gonna have to try.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey, where are the Jell-o shots?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don’t know, Chandler is supposed to be passin’ ‘em around...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Chandler!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hello-dillillio!!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, somebody’s feeling better.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) Stick out your tongue.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Take off your shirt!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh my God! How many of these things did you have? These are pure vodka.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, Jell-o just like Mom used to make.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering, to Ross) The most unbelievable thing happened to me today.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi! So I’m out having lunch at Monica’s and this guy starts talking to me, and it turns out he works for a buyer at Bloomingdale’s and there happens to be an opening in his department. So I gave him my phone number and he’s gonna call me this weekend to see if he can get me an interview!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wow!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, so this guy is helping you for no apparent reason?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh-huh!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And he’s, he’s a total stranger?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah! His name is um, Mark something.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Huh. Sounds like Mark Something wants to have some sex.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I’m just saying, I mean why else would he just, y'know, swoop in out of nowhere for no reason.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: To be nice.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, Joey. Are men ever nice to strange women for no reason?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, only for sex.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thank you. (to Rachel) So did you ah, did you tell Mark Something about me?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I didn’t have to, because I was wearing my ‘I heart Ross’ sandwich board and ringing my bell.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: S SISTERS
dialogue.text: (entering) Joey!!! Happy Birthday!! (all 7 of them look almost identical)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!! Hey-hey-hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Okay, how many of that girl are you seeing?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How hammered are you? Huh? These, these are Joey’s sisters.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hi Joey’s sisters!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to one of his sisters, Cookie) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: COOKIE
dialogue.text: Hey. What are we drinkin’ over here.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, I have ah, vodka and cranberry juice.

dialogue.speaker: COOKIE
dialogue.text: No kiddin,’ that’s the exact same drink I made myself right after I shot my husband.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow. Okay, I don’t know how to talk to you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, I’m taking my ex-girlfriend of my speed dialer.

dialogue.speaker: S SISTERS
dialogue.text: Oh!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No-no-no-no, no, it’s a good thing. Why must we dial so speedily anyway? Why must we rush through life? Why can’t we savor the precious moments? (to one of Joey’s sisters) Those are some huge breasts you have.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. So um, I-I heard about this ah, Mark guy that ah, Rachel met today.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Isn’t that great?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh yeah! So ah, kinda pretty, pretty good. He sounds like a nice, good guy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, he is. And he is so dreamy. I mean, y'know what, when he left I actually used the phrase, ‘Hummina-hummina-hummina.’ (walks away)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That’s excellent.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are eating breakfast.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) So, he’s just a nice guy. You really think this Mark doesn’t want anything in exchange for helping him?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I assume I’ll have to take showers with him, but y'know, that’s true of any job.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How ya feelin’?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, my apartment isn’t there anymore, because I drank it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Where’d you get too? We lost you after you opened up all the presents.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I ended up in the storage room, and not alone.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Woooo hoooo!!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ow, no ‘woo-hooing,’ no ‘woo-hooing.’

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Why, what happened?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ah, I fooled around with Joey’s sister. (Phoebe gasps) Well, that’s not the worst part.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What is the worse part?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can’t remember which sister.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) You see what men do! Don’t tell me men are not nice! (points to Chandler) This is men!!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Are you insane? I mean Joey, is going to kill you, he’s actually going to kill you dead.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay! You don’t think I thought of that?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: How can you not know which one?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I mean that’s unbelievable.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I mean, was it Gina?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Which one is Gina?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Dark, big hair, with the airplane earrings.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, no, no, that’s Dina.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Monica) You see you can’t tell which one is which either, dwha!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: We didn’t fool around with any of them. Dwha! Dwha!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Veronica. Look, it’s got to be Veronica, the girl in the red skirt. I definitely stuck my tongue down her throat.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That was me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Look, when I’ve been drinking, sometimes I tend to get overly friendly, and I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That’s okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That’s all right.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That’s okay.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (angrily entering, to Chandler) Can I talk to you for a second?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, Joey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey. (they all walk away from Chandler)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on!! (motions for Chandler to come with him)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Why can’t we talk in here? With, with, witnesses.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I just got off the phone with my sister.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, which, which one?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Mary-Angela.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Mary-Angela.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know which one was she again?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Why don’t you ask Chandler, ‘cause he’s the one that fooled around with her. She told me you said you could really fall for her. Now is that true? Or are you just gettin’ over Janice by groping my sister.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It’s gotta be the first one.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Really? That’s great! You and my sister, sittin’ in a tree.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yep, I’m in a tree.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is writing letters as Rachel enters.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Did he call? Did Mark call?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No honey, I’m sorry, but the weekend’s not over yet.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. (we hear laughing from the upstairs apartment) Oh my God, is that Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I guess they’re back from their date.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Music. Very nice.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So, how are you?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I am good. I finished my book.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, what’s it about?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don’t remember. Do you wanna take a walk?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, I do. (they both run out)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross is reading a letter that Chandler wrote.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Dear Mary-Angela. Hi. How’s it going. This is the hardest letter I’ve ever had to write. (to Chandler) What the hell’s a matter with you? How do you think Joey’s going to react when he finds out that you blew off his sister with a letter?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, that’s the part where you tell him that I moved to France. When actually I’ll be in Cuba.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All right, look, look, you’ve got to do this yourself, okay in person. At least you know her name. You just go to the house and you ask for Mary-Angela, okay, when which ever one she is comes to the door, you take her for a walk, you let her down easy.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What if Mary-Angela comes to the door and I ask for Mary-Angela?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Where in Cuba?

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Joey’s sister’s house, Chandler hits himself on the head three times
and knocks on the door three times. Joey answers it.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (shocked) Joey, what-wh-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-what are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Waiting for my Grandma to finish my laundry. What about you?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I’m here to see Mary-Angela.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You are so the man! (motions him to come in, and he does) Now look, listen, listen, you got to be cool, ‘cause my Grandma doesn’t know about you two yet, and you do not want to tick her off. She was like the sixth person to spit on Mussolini's hanging body. Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Where’s Mary-Angela?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: She’s right in there. (motions to the living room)

dialogue.speaker: S SISTERS
dialogue.text: Hey, Chandler!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Monica, Ross, and Rachel are there.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I can’t believe Mark didn’t call. It’s Sunday night, and he didn’t call.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Bummer.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Yeah, right. Look at you, you’re practically giddy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, I’m genuinely sorry the Mark thing didn’t work out. Look, Rach, I want only good things for you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wait a minute, why don’t you just call Mark. (they both look up in shock) I mean, who says you have to sit here and wait for him, you’ve got to make stuff happen.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: But, you, you don’t want to seem too pushy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Honey, it’s not pushy, he gave her his home number.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Rachel, as she gets his number) What, he gave you his home number? As in like, to, to his home?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, and you don’t mind if I call, because you only want good things for me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That’s right good things, that-that is what I said. (glances at Monica)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Hello, Mark? Hi, it’s Rachel Green. (listens) Oh no, don’t you apologize. (listens) Yeah, I’ll hold. (to Monica and Ross) He left my number at work, but he was helping his niece with her report on the pioneers.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That is so made up!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Yeah, oh my God, tomorrow! That, no, it’s perfect. Oh God, thank you soo much. Great! Bye! (hangs up phone) I got the interview!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yay!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: There you go.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: He even offered to meet me for lunch tomorrow to prep me for it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, that is amazing!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah well, if I know Mark, and I think I do, I’d expect nothing less.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I got to figure out what I’m going to wear.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: High collar and baggy pants say I’m a pro.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah! Right! Okay, I’ll see you guys later. (starts to leave) Woo hoo!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You go get ‘em. (to Monica) What did I do to you? Did I hurt you in some way?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ‘Why don’t you call him?!’ Well, thank you very much! Y'know now he is going to prep her, y'know prep her, as in what you do when you surgically remove the boyfriend!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Are you crazy?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Am I! Am I! Am I out of my mind! Am I losing my senses!! This dreamy guy is taking my girlfriend out for a meal.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?! Ross y'know this isn’t even about you! I mean this is about Rachel and something wonderful happening for her. I mean you know even if you’re right, what if he wants to sleep with her, does it mean he gets too?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I mean don’t you trust her?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, yeah!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Then get over yourself! Grow up!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (shyly) You grow up.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Joey’s sister’s house, they’re finishing up dinner.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: This teramisu is, is excellent. Did you make it Mary-Angela?

dialogue.speaker: S GRANDMOTHER
dialogue.text: No! I did!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, it’s, it’s yummy. So Mary-Angela do you like it?

dialogue.speaker: S GRANDMOTHER
dialogue.text: Of course! It’s her favorite.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So um, Mary-Angela, what’s your second favorite?

dialogue.speaker: S GRANDMOTHER
dialogue.text: More of Grandma’s teramisu.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Would you just please....give me the receipt ‘cause this is great. It’s top notch.

dialogue.speaker: S GRANDMOTHER
dialogue.text: That dies with me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So will I.

dialogue.speaker: S SISTER
dialogue.text: Excuse yourself, and go to the bathroom.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh no-no-no I was just squinting. That doesn’t mean anything.

dialogue.speaker: S SISTER
dialogue.text: (whispering in his ear) Just do it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Will you excuse me I have to um..... (walks to the hall)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (startled) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: S SISTER
dialogue.text: Finally, I thought we’d never be alone. Can I just tell you something, I have not stopped thinking about you since the party. (kisses him)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Look, I may have jumped the gun here. (she tries to kiss him, but he ducks it and moves away) Um, I just got out of a relationship and I’m not really in a, in a commitment kind of place.

dialogue.speaker: S SISTER
dialogue.text: So! Me neither! God, Mary-Angela was right you do have the softest lips.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ahhhh, you’re not Mary-Angela.

dialogue.speaker: S SISTER
dialogue.text: No, I’m Mary-Theresa.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: This is so bad. If-if you’re not Mary-Angela, then-then who is?

dialogue.speaker: MARY-ANGELA
dialogue.text: (standing behind Chandler) I am!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, this is soo bad. (doesn’t see Mary-Angela)

dialogue.speaker: MARY-ANGELA
dialogue.text: Joey!!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No Joey! No Joey! Don’t Joey! Joey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What’s goin’ on?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (pats him on the shoulder) You’re it! Now run and hide!

dialogue.speaker: MARY-THERESA
dialogue.text: It’s no big deal. Chandler was just kissin’ me because he thought I was Mary-Angela.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?! How could you do that, how could you think she was Mary-Angela?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I wasn’t sure which one Mary-Angela was. (all of Joey’s sisters gasp) Look, I’m sorry okay, I was really drunk, and you all look really similar.

dialogue.speaker: S SISTER
dialogue.text: I say, punch him Joey.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah! Punch him!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know what, we should all calm down because your brother’s not going to punch me. (to Joey) Are ya?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, that is usually what I would do. But I just never thought you’d be on the receiving end of it. How could you do this?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Joey if you wanna punch me, go ahead, I deserve it. But I just want you to know that I would never soberly hurt you or your family, you’re my best friend. I would never do anything like this ever again.

dialogue.speaker: COOKIE
dialogue.text: So what. I say, punch him.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah! Punch him! Punch him!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No! No! No! No, I’m not going to punch Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: COOKIE
dialogue.text: I’ll do it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No you won’t. Look he knows he did a terrible thing and I believe him, he’s sorry. But, (to Chandler) you’ve got one more apology to make, all right, you’ve got to apologize to Mary-Angela.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, absolutely!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You’ve got it. (he starts to look at his sister’s, but he still doesn’t know which one is Mary-Angela.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Cookie, now you can punch him!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?! (Cookie punches him)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A lobby, Ross is waiting for Rachel, after her interview.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (getting of the elevator and noticing Ross) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah y'know, this building is on my paper route so I... (gives her a flower)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi. (kisses her)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: How’d did it go?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh well, the woman I interviewed with was pretty tough, but y'know thank God Mark coached me, because once I started talking about the fall line, she got all happy and wouldn’t shut up.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I’m so proud of you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Me too!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Listen, I’m ah, I’m sorry I’ve been so crazy and jealous and, it’s just that I like you a lot, so...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Rachel?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah. (turns around) Hi Mark!

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Hi. I just talked to Joanna, and she loves you. You got it, you got the job.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I did!

dialogue.speaker: MARK
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Oh my God!! (she turns around and hugs Mark, not Ross)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Congratu!! (sees her hug Mark) -lations-lations.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, The entire gang is there.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So ah, Phoebe, how was your date?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh well y'know. (laughs)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, I do know.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ick, you were eavesdropping.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Eavesdropping. Pheebs, the ceiling tiles were falling down.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I’m sorry. But I really like this guy. And I think he really happens to like me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Maybe he’s just jumping on a pogo-stick and really likes it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Maybe the pogo-stick likes it too?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, that’s it! He cannot do this to Phoebe. (gets up) This guy is going to get the butt kicking of a lifetime! (stops and turns around and asks Rachel) But, is he a big guy?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, we’ll all go. (motions to Chandler) Come on. (the guys leave)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Thanks you guys! Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Don’t worry.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: God, I hope they kick his ass!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey, I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know if it’s any consolation, he really did sound like he was having more fun with you. (Rachel nods in agreement)

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: (muffled) May I help you?
